intro: Biggina angustata, commonly known as the narrowleaf biggina, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. It is typically found in open woodlands and disturbed soils, thriving in warm, humid climates. Biggina angustata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
